
---

<!-- WARNING: this file was generated by Pulumi Docs Generator. -->
<!-- Do not edit by hand unless you're certain you know what you are doing! -->

Retrieve information about a network for use in other resources.

This data source provides all of the network's properties as configured on your Civo account.

Networks may be looked up by id or label, and you can optionally pass region if you want to make a lookup for an expecific network inside that region.
## Schema

### Optional

- **id** (String) The ID of this resource.
- **label** (String) The label of an existing network
- **region** (String) The region of an existing network

### Read-Only

- **default** (Boolean) If is the default network
- **name** (String) The name of the network


{{% examples %}}

## Example Usage

{{< chooser language "typescript,python,go,csharp" / >}}





{{< example csharp >}}

```csharp
using Pulumi;
using Civo = Pulumi.Civo;

class MyStack : Stack
{
    public MyStack()
    {
        var test = Output.Create(Civo.GetNetwork.InvokeAsync(new Civo.GetNetworkArgs
        {
            Label = "test-network",
            Region = "NYC1",
        }));
    }

}
```


{{< /example >}}


{{< example go >}}

```go
package main

import (
	"github.com/pulumi/pulumi-civo/sdk/v2/go/civo"
	"github.com/pulumi/pulumi/sdk/v3/go/pulumi"
)

func main() {
	pulumi.Run(func(ctx *pulumi.Context) error {
		opt0 := "test-network"
		opt1 := "NYC1"
		_, err := civo.LookupNetwork(ctx, &civo.LookupNetworkArgs{
			Label:  &opt0,
			Region: &opt1,
		}, nil)
		if err != nil {
			return err
		}
		return nil
	})
}
```


{{< /example >}}


{{< example python >}}

```python
import pulumi
import pulumi_civo as civo

test = civo.get_network(label="test-network",
    region="NYC1")
```


{{< /example >}}


{{< example typescript >}}


```typescript
import * as pulumi from "@pulumi/pulumi";
import * as civo from "@pulumi/civo";

const test = pulumi.output(civo.getNetwork({
    label: "test-network",
    region: "NYC1",
}, { async: true }));
```
